data.title: I91738: Thomas P. BUMPASS (ABT 1809
data.text:
Notes

William Craig first immigrated to Ireland and then to America from Scotland.

Sources:...Immigrants to America about 1722

John Craig Allen Querie--Kentucky Ancestors 1973

"Virginia Valley Records" by John W. Wayland p. 307

"Gleanings of Virginia History," Boogher, 1965, Geal. Publ. Co., 1965

#6. Joseph D. Nickell

William Craig came to America in 1721 or 1722 from County Down or County Antrim, Ireland, settling in Lancaster County, or Chester County, [near Kennett's Square], Pa. in 1732, moved to Augusta County, Virginia, on the North West side of Middle River near Shenandoah [Liber 1, p. 30, Augusta county land records].

William Craigs will dated February 21, 1756, and recorded in Staunton November 26, 1759 gives 2/5 of his landed estate to his wife Janet [diminutive for Jean] and 1/5 per each of his three sons.

An old account book of James Craig, dating back to 1763, tells that the Craig family were in the siege of londonderry and in the Battle of the Boyne.

There is much more information of interest in "The Craigs of Augusta County Virginia" that anyone wanting to know more about this family should read.--Another note of interest--

Many of my ancestors fought and some died in the Rev. War.

Signed Steve A. Pritchett family researcher 2090 Hill Way st. Medford, Oregon 97504 e-mail [email protected] Last up date 1-30-00.

Children:

James Craig I b. Dec 1715 in Antrim, Ulster, Ireland

Robert Craig b. 1713 in Ireland

John Craig b. 1717 in Ireland

Sarah Craig b. 1718 in Rockingham Co, Virginia
